boardgame.name: Frontier Explorer (Issue 32 - Spring 2021)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to issue 32 of the Frontier Explorer. We start off with a “Blast from the Past” and a play report of an old Star Frontiers game from decades ago. The “Blast from the Past” series presents articles found on dead Star Frontiers websites or other places from before the magazine started and the early days of the game. This issue has three such articles, the a-ready mentioned play report, a system for resolving investigation of alien technology (or any complex task, really), and an in-setting card game you can bring to your table.

We have two articles on aircars and new flying vehicles by Jerry Boucher and Oscar Rios. Oscar also gives us a look at the life of a typical, non-adventuring vrusk.

The big article this issue is the first of a two-part series that looks at using radiation effects in the game by Joe Cabadas. The second half will be in issue 33.

Tom Verreault gives us a bevy of articles including reviews of a sci-fi map designer and Star Frontiers compatible miniatures, another character archetype, several bits of equipment, and finally, a detailed look at the published material on the Scree Fron system and its implications/extrapolations.

We round out the issue with our usual comics by Scott Mulder. Unfortunately, due to some unexpected events, Jurak Hangna was unable to transmit an article for this issue, but we should expect one from him next time. Which reminds me, I should check in with Alex Stone to see if he has any new adventures to report.

The full article list is:

Playing the Bad Guys
Frag Maps Review
Have Aircar, Will Travel …
Zoomers
The Vrusk Hustler
Radiation Hazards in the Frontier – part 1
Titan Rising: 2299 - episode 25
Alien Technology Flowcharts
An Industrious Life
IR Masking Skeinsuit and Military Toxyrad Gauge
The Expanded Medkit
Starbuckaroos
Soaring to New Heights on Hakosoar
Reaping New Star Frontiers Miniatures from Reaper
The Escape Plan #10
boardgame.rpgissuearticle: IR Masking Skeinsuit and Military Toxyrad Gauge
Radiation Hazards in the Frontier - Part 1
Reaping New Star Frontiers Miniatures from Reaper
Soaring to New Heights on Hakosoar

boardgame.name: Lollipops
boardgame.description:
Keep an eye out for the quantity, color, and type of candy. As soon as you see a common feature on 3 cards put them in your victory pile! Very fast, very simple, very fun.
There are 5 colours, 4 types of sweets and 3 options of quantity on the cards.
Cards are being laid out slowly.
All players watch the opened cards and act simultaneously.
As soon as there are 3 cards with a common feature on the table players have to identify the feature and say it out loud. E.g. "Ice cream!" or "Blue!" or "Two!"
Whoever calls out the feature first takes the cards.
The goal is to collect the most cards.
Where are some wild cards which can block a category or substitute any feature in category.

5 cool things about Lollipops

everyone loves sweets
fast-paced and noisy gameplay – perfect icebreaker
keeping in mind 3 features instantly pumps up the reaction, speed, and attentiveness
just a little space needed to play
easy to carry around.


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Aldebaran
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Aldebaran is a source book for Dark Stars and Faeries Wear Boots!

This book provides new archetypes, races and many monsters and magic options for either game or setting. If as a GM you wish to add horror and supernatural elements to your game involving Lovecraftian entities or demonic powers, this book provides material to do so.

If your players want to play a Paranormal investigator or a Metaphysical practitioner this book opens the door to do so in Dark Stars.

With 4 new archetypes, and 3 new races as well as attributes for many alien races in Dark Stars, this is the first “Alien” content source book. Finally, several “Hell Worlds” are sketched out allowing game masters to take their campaigns in multiple directions.

boardgame.name: Jagd auf den Feuerfisch
boardgame.description:
Divers go on an underwater hunt and must reach the firefish before their opponents in order to win. Whoever wins the respective trick can draw their diver and lay event cards. Each player has a stack of face-down cards and draws the top one. Whoever lays the highest draw card wins the trick and the cards. Then he draws the value of the collected move cards, won event cards he may place beforehand for his own advantage or disadvantage of the opponents. The full number must be drawn, several pieces may stand on one square, the target square must be reached directly, excess points must be drawn backwards.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Into the Wild
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Into the Wild is written for Old School Essentials but can be easily adapted for use with any OSR-style game. It combines and expands on six books by Third Kingdom Games: Classing up the Joint, Domain Building, Hexcrawl Basics, Random Weather Generation, OSR Expanded Classes, and Wealth by NPC level.

Designed to be used alone or as a companion book to Filling in the Blanks and a Guide to Thieves' Guilds, Into the Wild provides guidance for high level play. From exploring the wilderness to founding a domain, creating new classes for OSR games, and more. All of the artwork was commisioned for the book. The rules from the aforementioned six books have been revised and integrated into a coherent whole, with plenty of examples of how it works in play. Additionally, Into the Wild contains:

Random encounter tables designed to populate wilderness lairs, not just create random encounters.
A simple mass combat system designed to be used to resolve everything from large-scale pitched battles to large encounters in the wilderness for when you don't want to roll one hundred attack rolls.
Two pages of unit tokens for use with 1" battlemats and the mass combat system.
Example settlements and strongholds that are blank to be filled in by the Referee and used as needed.
Domain tracking sheets by James V West.
and more!

boardgame.name: ナンバースイッチ (Number Switch)
boardgame.description:
ナンバースイッチ (Number Switch) is a game from Japan, based upon a local news story. An electronics store was giving away a free Nintendo Switch, but didn't use a sensible method of picking the winning number. As a result, two customers had the numbers either side of the winning number. The game designer used this event as the inspiration for this deduction game.

The game uses a suit of 1-13 cards from a normal deck of playing cards. One player is the retailer, the other players are the customers in the lottery. The retailer shuffles the 13 cards and removes one in secret, which nobody sees.

Then the retailer divides the 12 remaining cards into two piles and sorts them each from low to high numbers, placing them face-down. The players take turns to draw the top card from a pile and after getting three hand cards, a player make declare the hidden card. If they are correct, they win.

If the cards run out and no player has guessed correctly, the retailer can declare a number card that a player has (deducing in reverse). If the player does hold that card in their hand, the retailer wins.

As with other games from Loserdogs, this was produced in a simple ziplock baggie with only a page of rules and 13 playing cards.
user summary

boardgame.name: Das Froschwanderspiel
boardgame.description:
The frogs (pawns) migrate from their winter quarters to the spawning water, but the pond is in danger of drying up. The players move their frogs, clean the pond and fill it with water again. The player whose turn it is draws event cards and the frogs move. They have to stop at danger spots and try to roll the number and the solution for the danger. If the attempt is unsuccessful, a dry stone enters the pond, but the other players can help, forego their movement and roll the dice to remove the danger. Once at the pond, the players can now remove dry stones, always according to the number of frogs already present. If there are fewer than 15 dry stones in the pond at the end and there is no toxic waste in the pond, the players have won.

—user summary

boardgame.name: Entrate nel Natale!
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Benvenuti al nuovo, originale, esclusivo Sotterraneo Natalizio, pensato per trascorrere in allegria le feste di Natale!

boardgame.name: The Final Light-Year: The Delta Sector
boardgame.description:
May 2021 episode for The Final Light-Year.

This kit adds a new map, new crew and a new set of enemies, but instead of a new boss, the kit brings a Spaceport postcard that introduces longer form campaign play.

You'll place the spaceport between two sector maps and play two full games, with a little extra trouble in-between. The enemies and boss at the second sector are boosted, but you can use actions in the first sector to weaken them. It's an all new type of balance, looking toward the long game.

This is the first of many spaceports, each twisting the two game campaign in a new way, and even allowing bigger and bigger campaigns as more are released.


Released in the May 2021 Board Game of the Month Club $5+ package.

boardgame.name: Robodance
boardgame.description:
Find a robot with the right combination of shapes or colors. Repeat the move and collect the winning card.
Do the robot dance!

There are 20 cards with robots. Each has a unique combination of colors, shapes, and a unique movement. Small cards indicate colors and shapes.
To enjoy the game call your children and their friends, put 20 robot cards in a circle, small cards are in the center. Each round you open a small card. All players are looking for a robot with such colors or shapes. The first person to repeat the move receives the small card as a victory point. The goal is to collect the most cards.
5 cool things about ROBODANCE

active and dynamic game
combines developing fast response and attention with movement.
the moves such as dab, rock, and peace sign are trendy and kids like to repeat them.
the complexity can be easily adjusted
all players are included in the process throughout the game.


—description from the publisher

boardgame.name: Make Happy
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

WHAT’S UP WITH HARMONY AND CASTLE SWOON?

The players have a very very important meeting to attend at Castle Swoon.

The only problem is that Harmony, the sentient gate, is very very sad, their frown making it impossible for them to open. No one can get in or out, which is a problem for Swoon’s blooming franchising businesses.

Having artificial workers is cheap: the success with Harmony, instead of real live guards with salaries, turned out great. Swoon offloaded workers to replace with an artificial workforce, while the previous employees sought fortune on other islands.

Harmony misses their friends very very much.
Please go fetch them for a reunion!

So what is inside?

Made for Troika!, the Other World's favourite fantasy role-playing game!
10+ Monsters or New Friends.
4 unique adventure locations to explore, each featuring several points of interest.
A mystery underground location.
Pretty colour illustrations by the author on every spread.
Edited by the illustrious Jarrett Crader.
16 pages of fun!
Bonus: Includes a track of sad ambient background music, created specifically for this adventure. Randomly generated with D6 based algorithms, in D Minor which, according to Google, is the saddest key.
Good for an approximately 3 hr one-shot or played over two sessions focused on exploration.

boardgame.name: Skulls of Sedlec: Poets
boardgame.description:
Poets is a 6-card expansion that shuffles into the game, adds the ability to play with a 4th player and is fully compatible with the solo expansion, Skulls of Sedlec: Monstrance, as well.

This expansion to Skulls of Sedlec adds a new type of skull: the Poets. Poets want to be next to forlorn Romantics. They score points per adjacent, non-scoring Romantic. For those that can't seem to pair up the romantics, you might split them up on purpose now to get the most points out of your poets.

Adding in the expansion is easy, just shuffle in the expansion cards to the base game and play.

listing.notes: INCLUDES FIRST THREE NON-SOLO EXPANSIONS (CASTLE GAURDS, EXECUTIONERS, & POETS)

Poets expansion only, does not come with base game.
Free USPS shipping

boardgame.name: Gearworks: Playmat
boardgame.description: 24" x 20" Neoprene playmat, 2mm thick

boardgame.name: Half Now & Half Later
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

A Troika! Sphere full of plots and schemes.

Introduce yourself to six NPCs.
Three tables of hooks.

boardgame.name: Hard Wired Island
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

THE YEAR IS 2020

Humanity has spread to space. GRAND CROSS is a space station orbiting Earth, a high-tech city, and a gateway to the stars. But in this distant future, it's in crisis...

HARD WIRED ISLAND is a retrofuture cyberpunk TTRPG, inspired by 90s anime.

boardgame.name: PURI! PURI! 漏ルカー (Poo Poo Leaker)
boardgame.description:
This is a freebie game from Toryo Hojo designed as a "クソゲーRTA" (kusoge real time attack), which is a speed run to make a shitty game.

Players race to the finish line by rolling dice and choosing a result to use for movement, placing poop markers in the space they have left. If a poop marker is in the destination space, the player is eliminated. If another player's piece in the space, the active player rolls for movement again.

The game ends when either a single player remains on the board, or if a player crosses the finish line.

This was distributed as part of the Spring 2021 Market Crash pack and players must provide their own playing pieces.

boardgame.name: う～っ「まん防」！ (Mmm..."Manbo!")
boardgame.description:
This is a freebie game by Toryo Hojo where players are the head of local Japanese government and try to reduce the number of people affected by the decline of the economy from COVID-19.
Players muct make good use of the “Manbo” policy to slow down the new Coronavirus!

Each player controls regions of Japan that have a matrix of infected population and economic health. On their turn, a player rolls dice and performs an action from the chart:


COVID excise tax increase
Healthcare subsidy
Unemployment stimulus
Stay-at-home request
Go eat
Go travel
"Manbo!"


With the other die, they must raise the infected population of the matching region.

Because the COVID outbreak occurred in the same year the Tokyo Olympics were scheduled to happen, the torch relay happens contemporaneously with player actions and is used as a timer for the end of the game.

The game was included as a part of the Spring 2021 Market Crash pack.

boardgame.name: ボッチャのようなもの (Some Kind of Boccia)
boardgame.description:
This is a freebie game designed by Toryo Hojo and requires players to provide their own pieces for play. It was included in the Spring 2021 Market Crash pack.

Two players compete in a tabletop game of bocce. Players from the red side and the blue side compete by throwing the ball into the court. First, a white ball called “jack” is thrown into the court, and then the red and the blue sides both throw a ball toward the jack. The side with the ball farthest from the jack is the side that throws their balls in first. When one team has used up all their balls, the other team throws their remaining balls into the court. When all the balls have been thrown into the court, the side with the ball closest to the jack scores.

The throws are determined via dice rolls, which also determine the initial drop point of the thrown ball, any deflections of the ball if it collides with another, and the final landing space of all balls involved in the throw and resulting collisions. The board is comprised of a matrix of potential die rolls.

And advanced game adds "focus," which is used to give better direction to the throws.

boardgame.name: Dwarven Depths - Grand Temple
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Straight after the Minor Temples area, going eastward, lies the Grand Temple. No one but those who visited it, can ever describe the greatness and the beauty of this temple dedicated to the Stone God. A grand church featuring a huge statue of the Stone God dominates the area. Great black stone pillars, finely crafted with detailed bas-reliefs and unique stonework rise up to the ceiling, which is so high that cannot be seen. Many prayer areas dot the grand church. The floor is a mastodontic stone slab carved with millions of bas-reliefs, brought into place by no other than the Stone God itself, legend tells. Many side rooms, accessible through secret doors, feature hidden libraries, sacred forges and barracks of Stone God templars, an elite priests’ group that sworn obedience to the Stone God.

boardgame.name: L'Oro dello Spettro
boardgame.description:
Modul di avventura per principianti (personaggi di livello 1-4)

Publisher's blurb:

Esplorate le infide Acque Marce e inoltratevi negli acquitrini che un tempo erano una terra ridente e popolosa. Avrete il coraggio di sfidare il terrificante mostro del lago, che sorveglia il tesoro perduto di un’antica famiglia ormai estinta?

boardgame.name: Ombre su Tulek
boardgame.description:
Modul di avventura per principianti (personaggi di livello 1-4)

Publisher's blurb:

Trovate la via d’uscita dal dungeon dopo averne esplorato i cunicoli più oscuri e pericolosi. Ora il richiamo delle Terre Selvagge del Feudo di Garòvia fa ardere il vostro spirito avventuroso, avrete il coraggio di rispondere al suo canto?

boardgame.name: Nardrov
boardgame.description:
Modul di avventura per principianti (personaggi di livello 1-4)

Publisher's blurb:

Cosa accade quando su un’isola deserta si trovano delle rovine, disabitate da migliaia di anni? Cosa può succedere quando si scopre che queste vestigia sono aliene? Fama, potere o… pericolo?

boardgame.name: Caccia a Korindal
boardgame.description:
Modul di avventura per principianti (personaggi di livello 1-4)

Publisher's blurb:

I nani di Monte Cavo sono in pericolo, assediati nella loro roccaforte da una bellicosa tribù di centauri. Riuscirete a correre in loro aiuto, evitando i razziatori goblin e le altre insidie che stanno in agguato nelle Terre Selvagge?

boardgame.name: I Fratelli Roccianera in Esilio
boardgame.description:
Modul di avventura per principianti (personaggi di livello 1-4)

Publisher's blurb:

Due giganti delle colline stanno portando scompiglio e distruzione nel bucolico villaggio di Borgo Salice. Toccherà ai personaggi, con l’aiuto di una bellissima maga, correre in soccorso dei paesani e liberarli dai mostri importuni.

boardgame.name: Il Mausoleo di Nim-Dhul
boardgame.description:
Modul di avventura per esperti (personaggi di livello 5-10)

Publisher's blurb:

Siete stati ingaggiati da un famoso stregone per esplorare la tomba a lungo perduta di un antico arcimago, zeppa di favolosi oggetti magici e tesori incantati, che si dice sia protetta da innumerevoli guardiani e micidiali trabocchetti.

boardgame.name: Alghe Rosso Sangue (LL)
boardgame.description:
Modul di avventura per esperti (personaggi di livello 5-10)

Publisher's blurb:

Il ricco mercante Luides Argravazio vi ha reclutati per scortarlo in una missione commerciale nei territori non civilizzati del Feudo di Garòvia, in cerca di una preziosa spezia. Saprete sopravvivere a tutte le insidie delle Terre Selvagge?

boardgame.name: La Fortezza di Gholand
boardgame.description:
Modul di avventura per esperti (personaggi di livello 5-10)

Publisher's blurb:

Seguendo una vecchia mappa del tesoro, dovrete addentrarvi nella pericolosa giungla del Bosco Intricato per recuperare un leggendario tridente fiammeggiante appartenuto a un feroce signore della guerra dei giganti del fuoco.

boardgame.name: Act One
boardgame.description:
'"For sheer fun, it's one hard act to follow . . ."

Act One is the exciting game where players do "almost anything" to try and get their teammates to guess titles of popular movies and TV shows. You'll laugh your head off (until it's your turn) watching your teammates do their best to act or read famous lines from movies and TV shows while they try to beat the clock (actually it's a sand-timer). The sooner teams guess titles correctly, the more points are scored! (But, who cares who wins, when it's this much fun).

No batteries necessary . . . Teammates not included.

Almost two thousand movie and TV moments from the 70's, 80's and 90's. Great party game.

Games Magazine Top Games Selection

Now includes: 25% more cards & the new "Almost Anything Goes" round!'

—description from the back of the box

boardgame.name: Spacers
boardgame.description:
You are a spacer; a freelance space traveler in a brand new solar system. You have a ship, a handful of spacebucks, and a wealth of opportunities. How will you become famous?

Spacers is a space adventure game where the goal is to become the most famous traveler in the solar system. You are free to earn fame in a variety of different ways, allowing you to live out the space adventure fantasy that you want. Engage in pick-up and deliver tasks, dice-based combat missions, and even choose-you-own-adventure style encounters!


Trading! Exploring! Smuggling! Pirating!
Evolving supply and demand system
Encounters with varied outcomes
Randomized setup
Virtually limitless ways to play


—description from the designer

boardgame.name: La Torre delle Stelle
boardgame.description:
Modul di avventura per esperti (personaggi di livello 5-10)

Publisher's blurb:

Per aiutare un’infelice principessa elfica a scoprire il fato toccato al suo generoso padre, il leggendario Signore delle Stelle, dovrete intraprendere una missione in cui affronterete ostacoli e avversari usciti dai vostri peggiori incubi.

boardgame.name: Mille Anni nella Prigione di Rame
boardgame.description:
Modul di avventura per esperti (personaggi di livello 5-10)

Publisher's blurb:

Il duca di Thilsea vi ha incaricato di indagare sulla scomparsa di due navi della flotta e sulla cessazione di ogni contatto con l’arcipelago delle Isole Shalazoa. Quali misteri vi attendono tra le acque tempestose dell’oceano?

boardgame.name: Il Sigillo del Serpente (LL)
boardgame.description:
Modul di avventura per esperti (personaggi di livello 5-10)

Publisher's blurb:

Quale legame unisce una setta misteriosa, la strana placca di ferro ritrovata sul cadavere di un vecchio ucciso in un vicolo buio, alcuni terremoti inspiegabili e un’inestimabile raccolta perduta di antichi tomi?

boardgame.name: Il Castello di Kraggenkrest
boardgame.description:
Modul di avventura per specialisti (personaggi di livello 11-14)

Publisher's blurb:

Quale tragedia si è abbattuta trent’anni fa sulla casata dei Kraggen? È stato il mago di corte a evocare un demone sterminatore oppure sono gli dèi stessi che hanno maledetto il barone? Toccherà a voi svelare l’oscuro segreto.

boardgame.name: La Conchiglia del Dio delle Maree
boardgame.description:
Modul di avventura per specialisti (personaggi di livello 11-14)

Publisher's blurb:

Per garantire l’avverarsi di una profezia siete stati incaricati di riportare una conchiglia sacra sull’isola misteriosa da dove è stata trafugata. Sarete in grado di adempiere all’incarico assegnatovi dal dio delle maree?

boardgame.name: Il Sigillo d'Ambra
boardgame.description:
Modul di avventura per veterani (personaggi di livello 15-20)

Publisher's blurb:

Quale oscuro potere si cela dietro le orde di non morti che stanno devastando il regno? Il re in persona vi ha incaricato di risolvere il mistero e, per farlo, dovrete svelare i segreti celati nel gelido cuore dei Picchi dei Giganti.

boardgame.name: L'Ira della Grande Serpe
boardgame.description:
Modul di avventura per veterani (personaggi di livello 15-20)

Publisher's blurb:

Per porre fine agli spaventosi incubi che tormentano l’intero regno dovrete placare la terribile collera vendicativa d’un antico arcidiavolo, guidati soltanto da un’oscura profezia che vi condurrà in luoghi maledetti.

boardgame.name: La Triade del Male
boardgame.description:
Modul di avventura per veterani (personaggi di livello 15-20)

Publisher's blurb:

Siete stati convocati dai reggenti di Tyrnavia per sconfiggere un terribile drago non morto che incombe sulla cittadina. Ma oscuri segreti e pericoli ben più gravi sono in agguato, minacciando la sopravvivenza dell’intero regno.

boardgame.name: Alchemical Greenery
boardgame.description:
From Introduction:

Even before King Geddorah’s armies had breached the walls around Ardoussarlis, they had begun polluting the land with noxious alchemicals. Their siege engines bombarded it day and night with acidic fluids and explosive powders, even turning to cursed refuse, experimental drugs, and volatile mutagens before the end. But these were as nothing to the alchemical pollution unleashed upon the earth when the city’s arcane workshops were looted and burned.

The Sakhab Wastes are grey and rocky, mostly devoid of plant life. Standing in stark contrast, the city at the heart of this wasteland is bursting with greenery. It is not the bounty some might expect, however, for not all of these plants are waiting, passively, to be eaten. Some have mutated, becoming more like animals — malevolent, carnivorous, and deadly. The most dangerous is the bubblehorn flower and its caustic vines. Though not a flesh-eater, this plant is nonetheless a murderous threat to animal life. Even worse, it is a plant that, by its very nature, samples the alchemical detritus of the earth and produces yet more of these dangerous substances. As if this city were not already polluted enough.

This plant begins with poison roots. Are they a small man or a large mandrake root? They are certainly mobile enough, running and sneaking in search of suitable soil. Once a place is found, it buried itself and sprouts a set of caustic vines and, eventually, a bubblehorn flower. If this flower or its vines are killed, the roots become active again, to seek out a new place to grow. For this very reason, this weed is impossible to get rid of.

boardgame.name: La Cripta del Male è Aperta
boardgame.description:
La Saga di Pestula (personaggi di livello 6-10)

Publisher's blurb:

Sarete in grado di scoprire cos’è accaduto a Plonius il segugio, un intrepido ramingo benvoluto da tutti che ha difeso la sua gente innumerevoli volte dalle insidie degli umanoidi e ora si è macchiato di un orribile crimine?

boardgame.name: Heroes of Stalingrad: War Stories – Otto Carius
boardgame.description:
War Stories is a series of smaller expansions, much like Heroes of Normandie's Gazettes from before, but with a tighter focus on historical events and soldiers.

Where Gazettes where products designed for die-hard fans, War Stories will be more accessible, requiring less of the massive backlog of previously released expansions. War Stories will mostly be playable with just the core box, and the content of a War Stories issue itself, obviously.

Each issue will focus on a War Hero and will include a biography, his exploits, a dedicated scenario and one or two punchboards to integrate it into your game.

The first issue will be for Heroes of Stalingrad, and focuses on Otto Carius, a German Tiger tank commander who destroyed a total of 150 enemy tanks. This issue will also include a section of T34s for the Russian forces as well as the errata of the Frontoviks from the Heroes of Stalingrad game base box.

Featuring new artwork from Nicola Angius.

—description from the publisher
boardgame.boardgameexpansion: Heroes of Normandie: Big Red One Edition

listing.notes: Includes shipping to US via USPS Priority Mail
Title: Heroes of Stalingrad War Stories 1 Otto Carius Publisher: Devil Pig Games

boardgame.name: La Mazza dell'Infermità
boardgame.description:
La Saga di Pestula (personaggi di livello 6-10)

Publisher's blurb:

Tutti gli abitanti di un remoto villaggio sono deceduti, apparentemente a causa di una qualche epidemia virulenta, e i non morti ora dimorano nel paese. Saprete risolvere il mistero che aleggia su Granmulino?

boardgame.name: Selezione Innaturale
boardgame.description:
La Saga di Pestula (personaggi di livello 6-10)

Publisher's blurb:

Orribili creature ibride si aggirano vicino alla torre di un mago, mentre un uomo che porta una verga con in cima un teschio viaggia per il paese diffondendo morte e malattie. Il potere di Pestula continua a crescere…

boardgame.name: L'Arazzo del Passaggio
boardgame.description:
La Saga di Pestula (personaggi di livello 6-10)

Publisher's blurb:

È arrivato il momento della resa dei conti! I seguaci di Pestula hanno schierato tutte le forze per ostacolare la vostra missione, dal cui esito dipenderà se sarete in grado di infliggere il colpo finale alle ambizioni di Melengar.

boardgame.name: Book of Scarlet Abomination
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Wrath and Whimsy

Devourer and protector, aid to sorcery and blood crazed belligerent alike, the Horned Queen consumes, infects, and mutates. To some she offers aid and, for others, enlightenment. Can you survive the sights she has to show you?

The Book of Scarlet Abomination is your guide to the cambion princess, Tamarah Pandoramicum and the fell effects she has on those she champions. A full patron write up for the demon, Tamarah Pandoramicum complete with invoke results, taints, spellburn, and unique patron magics.

Also

The Queen’s Doom - A description of her court and the planes it intersects.

Several NPCs detailing those aided and trapped by the Horned Queen.

A bestiary describing that which can be summoned from her Doom

60 pages packed with demonic mayhem
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Apocrypha Obscura: Transmissions from the Dreaming Gynoid
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Weird fantasy, weird space, venture seeds, and the weird sisters of Dagger 9mm! A compilation from the first years of the Dreaming Gynoid blog. Compiled from five years worth of articles, posts, and missives, many no longer available,

Do note that most of this material has been previously published, often in a somewhat different form, on the Dreaming Gynoid blog from 2018 to the present. Some material also appeared prior on the “Swords of Jaldipoor,” “I Shoot Him in the Face!” and “Lens of Unrectified Night” Blogs, from 2015-2018.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Sub-ether Zero, Zero: Wretched Hives of Maleth Noir
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Role playing investigative pulp adventure …. On (and in, and under) Maleth Noir, players portray characters in a science fantasy world of super science, psionics, and alien magic where investigators venture into deep shadows in search of often uncomfortable truths. Noir is a far, far future space opera set on an old, civilized, and decadent city world merely one of millions of worlds in a sprawling multi-species Empire. Far Future, Low Life.

A zine for the Space Punk Renaisance. Powered by, compatible with, and intended for, the DCC RPG.
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Sub-ether 2
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Orphans of the Black – a funnel in Three Acts for Galaxy Black and the DCC RPG!

Run, Leave home! Voyage to the Middlemarches! Save the Doomed Ship! Try not to die alone on an airless rock in space

The unusual structure of the adventure allows it to be used with any of three starting points, any of three starting groups of PCs, each with their own agenda and purpose.

Run each chapter as a one off or drop in, run it start to finish, or run with three different groups acting simultaneously at a con!

Run the adventure in any order!

Run the segments separately, or together!

Three different sets of zeros are set against the universe, and possibly each other.

School, Clan, or Independent

Yet another chapter in the endless game of Galactic co-existence begins

Sub-ether 1 – Orphans of the Black

Plus the Space Alphabet

Gods of the Imperium

And a bunch of snarky pregens
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Colony Black: Sub-ether Annual 01
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Welcome to the imperial frontier.

Want to get way from the law, the public eyes, the constant surveillance, and all the damn biometrics? Come one, come all. Want to make use of some wacky sociopolitical theory that just would Never. Fly in imperial space? Start your own commune or temple!

Each time someone has come to the cluster and tried to recover, or reactivate the portals and gates here, disaster has struck. If the Company, the authorities, or worse – the Player Characters – get their hands on these portals will it happen again? How soon?

A sample colony, rules to found your own barebones colony on the frontier, all the possible threats that could manifest, and just maybe, how to forge a destiny for your new world. It’s all up to you – the tools are here for you to explore, exploit, and survive.

Tools for solitaire or one on one play

A sourcebook for the New Orien cluster, recently cut off from the Imperial frontier.

And more story hooks and venture seeds than you can possibly shake a portal control wand at!
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Galaxy Black I: Characters and Classes
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

First in the Galaxy Black series. A full generation system for imperial aliens as NPCs or as full player characters, with adjustable but deep levels of granularity. All of the core classes for Galaxy Black are contained within. All fully compatible with DCC.

Note: this is part of the Galaxy Black series and is not a complete game unto itself. IT requires the DCC RPG and Galaxy Black II Magic, Metaphysics, and Psychic powers.

Galaxy black is a science fiction and space fantasy toolkit for your DCC RPG game. With Galaxy Black you should be able to fake your way through your favorite SF franchise without any problems at all – from golden age space opera to grotty modern post-cyberpunk, from the gutter to the stars, and all points in between.

Galaxy black is also, for those who want it, a setting, showing one example of how using all the elements in the book (and there are a lot of them!) together can work, using a traditional golden age Galactic Empire as a model.

Galaxy black is generators! Make worlds, cultures, aliens, gods, and technology, use the campaign frameworks and adventure generators to inspire or map out a whole adventure, a whole campaign!

Galaxy black has character classes, psionics, weird alien magic, demons, daemons, and terrifying new vistas of unreality
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Galaxy Black II: Magic Metaphysics Magic and Psi Powers
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

So what is in Galaxy Black II? A full psychic tradition, inspired by Moorcock, Le Guin, Otomo, and Dick but also Charles Fort, Madame Blavatsky, plus Al Bester, Elfquest and the Tomorrow People

Magic – the most immediately applicable to your DCC game; the imperial magical tradition, new arcane affinities, bizarre powers of illusion and necromancy.

Metaphysics – A detailed variant of the DCC magic system providing a flexible third metaphysical tradition, psychic powers. This is presented with a host of rules and options to exist alongside the Wizard and Clerical abilities and is of comparable flexibility and potency.

Psychic Powers – finally, a starting selection of psychic powers from level one to five are presented in full detail

Fold Space, Defy Time, Bend the Stars to your will

The human race is gone but humanity lives on, it’s culture and genome infecting a million worlds.

Nothing is ever forgotten Even in a Collapsing Universe; the struggle of Law and Chaos goes on.


What is Galaxy Black?

Galaxy black is a science fiction and space fantasy toolkit for your DCC RPG game. A lightly gothic semi-humorous fantasy of the space future that was, and could still be, one day. With magic, bright colours, and deep implications. For everyone.

With Galaxy Black you should be able to fake your way through your favorite SF

franchise without any problems at all – from golden age space opera to grotty modern post-cyberpunk, from the gutter to the stars, and all points in between.

Galaxy black is also, for those who want it, a setting, showing one example of how using all the elements in the book (and there are a lot of them!) together can work, using a traditional golden age Galactic Empire as a model.

Galaxy black is generators! Make worlds, cultures, aliens, gods, and technology, use the campaign frameworks and adventure generators to inspire or map out a whole adventure, a whole campaign!

Galaxy black has character classes, psionics, weird alien magic, demons, daemons, and terrifying new vistas of reality
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Galaxy Black III: Star Travel and the Sub-ether
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

Star travel! Plumb the depts of the Sub-ether on psychedelic voyagers in time and space.

The Wreckage of a Million dead civilizations amid the souls of a galaxy dying.

The Noosphere –learn of the psychic plane of information and how it exerts tremendous pressure on the Sub-ether, fear contagious mental illness and infectious memes. Learn of the persistent Idea Gods of the Inner Core and how (and why) nothing is ever forgotten.

Splinters – the million shadows converge in the Sub-ether, and starships regularly call on worlds slightly out of synch with one another.

Ghost Tech – the dead as a natural resource, the hubris of a society with tso little regard for what has come before, and the countless ways the dead try to seek vengeance

Drink you ghost tea, say a prayer, and dive into the Sub-ether.

The human race is gone but humanity lives on, it’s culture and genome infecting a million worlds.

Nothing is ever forgotten Even in a Collapsing Universe; the struggle of Law and Chaos goes on.

What is Galaxy Black?

Galaxy black is a science fiction and space fantasy toolkit for your DCC RPG game. A lightly gothic semi-humorous fantasy of the space future that was, and could still be, one day. With magic, bright colours, and deep implications. For everyone.

With Galaxy Black you should be able to fake your way through your favorite SF

franchise without any problems at all – from golden age space opera to grotty modern post-cyberpunk, from the gutter to the stars, and all points in between.

Galaxy black is also, for those who want it, a setting, showing one example of how using all the elements in the book (and there are a lot of them!) together can work, using a traditional golden age Galactic Empire as a model.

Galaxy black is generators! Make worlds, cultures, aliens, gods, and technology, use the campaign frameworks and adventure generators to inspire or map out a whole adventure, a whole campaign!

Galaxy black has character classes, psionics, weird alien magic, demons, daemons, and terrifying new vistas of reality
boardgame.rpg: Dungeon Crawl Classics Role Playing Game

boardgame.name: Aetherway (Revised)
boardgame.description:
From publisher blurb:

THE AETHERWAY is a network of pathways, portals, and passages linking countless planets and planes. It remains more affordable than commissioning a vessel and charting a route directly through the aether, but a wrong turn may leave one abruptly ejected into alien environments. Travelers are advised to bring companions and an umbrella.

Aetherway is a quirky, planet-hopping RPG zine, compatible with both Tunnel Goons and Troika!* In addition to being a fully functional game in its own right, you can use it to supplement the background list for your Troika! game, to run Troika! adventures with Tunnel Goons rules (or vice versa), or to introduce some odd people and places to any game of interplanar exploration you like.

In a compact 16 pages (including covers), it includes…

36 brief, travel-oriented character backgrounds with skills, spells, and items
36 pathways and portals between worlds
Two 36-item lists to generate places one might visit across the planes
Three 36-item lists to generate peoples of various planets
Three 36-item lists to generate strange creatures of the cosmos
36 travel-oriented adventure seeds
36 magical mishaps for miscast spells


[*]But wait, you say, how can it be compatible with TWO different games?! So glad you asked! This slim booklet includes a half a letter-sized page adapting Tunnel Goons rules to use them with Troika! backgrounds, plus a letter-sized spread distilling the Troika! rules.

boardgame.name: Zombicide (2nd Edition): Daily Zombie Spawn Set
boardgame.description:
Contains 31 Daily Zombie Spawn Figures and a rules leaflet.

This is a Kickstarter exclusive extra.

listing.notes: Part of the kickstarter all-in pledge.
Will upload some photos asap. Feel free to bid

boardgame.name: Il Grande Libro degli Avventurieri
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Una guida indispensabile per tutti gli appassionati di D&D, che permette di creare in pochi, semplici passi e con tutti i dettagli necessari, qualsiasi nuova Classe di personaggio!

boardgame.name: Guida a Cynidicea
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Un nuovo Atlante che descrive in dettaglio lo straordinario mondo sotterraneo di Cynidicea, già introdotto nella classica avventura B4: The Lost City.

boardgame.name: Il Tomo della Sapienza Arcana
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Una raccolta di dieci differenti grimori magici, con incantesimi per Basic Dungeons & Dragons, Advanced Dungeons & Dragons (2nd Edition), Advanced Heroquest, Lex Arcana e Tunnels & Trolls, frutto dell'inventiva di nove Autori differenti.

boardgame.name: Forts & Forests: The War for North America
boardgame.description:
In Forts & Forests: The War for North America, you command one of the 18th century’s great superpowers in a struggle to control Canada, the American colonies and the vast wealth of the continent beyond.

But the French & Indian War is only part of a greater global conflict, so resources are limited and must be allocated with care. Militia is easily raised but unreliable. Regular forces deliver power and strength under fire, but they are expensive and must be transported across an ocean. Then there are gifts to the Indians, whose speed and fierce ambushes can turn the tide of the war, but only if their pricey allegiance can be maintained.

Forts & Forests begins with the British poised to launch an ambitious four-pronged attack to bring the war to a speedy end. They have greater numbers, naval superiority and secure ports, but much of their army is made up of untested colonial provincial forces. The push inland from the Atlantic coast will be difficult, and the support of the powerful Iroquois is tepid at best.

Though outnumbered, most French troops are battle hardened regulars recently arrived from Europe. They are supported by fearsome hordes of western tribes who have been convinced to take up the hatchet against the English invaders. New France also has a geographic advantage; troops and supplies can be moved quickly along the St. Lawrence and Great Lakes with relative ease. But the connection to France is tenuous, especially if the bastion at Louisbourg were to fall!

Forts & Forests’ unique combat system captures the challenges and uncertainties of the wilderness war. Over 300 historically accurate unit cards capture their differing combat, ambush, break, and speed ratings. No battle is a sure victory regardless of numerical superiority!

It will take strategy, determination, and a bit of luck to conquer a land of Forts & Forests and win the War for North America.

—description from the publisher

listing.notes:
Limited supply of new copies of Forts & Forests: The War for North America available at a 25% discount vs. MSRP.
Games are new but shrink wrap removed.

boardgame.name: L'Isola del Ghiaccio e del Fuoco
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Una nuova ambientazione completa per le tue avventure di WFRP, con nuovi mostri, incantesimi, dèi e una terra unica da esplorare, all'estremo nord del Vecchio Mondo.

boardgame.name: Bestiario Unico
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Un eccezionale bestiario con moltissime creature del folklore fantastico, magistralmente realizzato dalla Società Bibliografica Laitiana.

boardgame.name: Primo Almanacco
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Una raccolta di materiale creato per poter migliorare la giocabilità di Kata Kumbas: dalle regole all’ approfondimento dell’ambientazione.

boardgame.name: Humans vs. Humans: Wasteland
boardgame.description:
A red dash is spotted in the night sky above a rotting and decaying Earth. The city of Savannah, once a prospering megapolis, has now been ruined and abandoned for hundreds of years. Small bands of scavengers dwell among the remains, and the vast majority of North America has become an unforgiving wasteland, populated by crazed desert tribes desperate to fulfill the mad whims of their made-up deities. Those least affected by the destruction quickly succumb to crime and corruption in absence of a stable government. In want of something greater than their broken lives, these individuals follow the signal from the sky and search for the crash. What lies behind this mysterious incident? Is it hope? Redemption? Aliens?

Not even the maddest of Maxes could save these fools.


Humans vs. Humans: Wasteland (HvH) is a Live-Action Role-Playing game that revolves around team-based combat using Nerf or alternative brand foam blasters. Over the course of multiple days, players can participate in faction-led missions, buy class upgrades with in-game currency, and unearth the secrets of the wasteland in a heavily detailed ARG.



Key Features


Blast your way to victory as you compete against other players in 10 action-filled missions.
Team-based system that rewards cooperation. When peril lurks in every direction, it’s dangerous to go alone.
Gameplay system that encourages unique play-styles and approaches. Do the talking directly or let your blaster say it for you.
Multiple factions looking for your support. Pledge loyalty to a cause or bounce from faction to faction in search of the best payouts.
Versatile perk system that allows you to play the game however you want. Want to be anarchist grunt that dual-wields swords? No problem! What about a medic that holds back and heals your teammates? The choice is yours.
Purchasable equipment with in-game currency. Trade and barter with other players for the best deals. Who knows? When everything has a price, you might even be able to bribe the shop keep with the right bit of info.
Fully fleshed out ARG that runs parallel to the main missions. Not interested in fighting in missions? Help your team by solving puzzles outside of combat.


It’s like playing a video game in real life! No longer do you have to shout in the void of digitally rendered spaces only to hear an echo: when real people are interacting with you, they have to respond!

Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: La Rinascita di Laitia
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Espansione non ufficiale del gioco di ruolo Kata Kumbas che consente di trasformare quello che era un gioco di proiezione, in una simulazione di vita virtuale.

boardgame.name: Conestoga
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Gioco di ruolo "space opera" ambientato nell'anno 6656. L'Imperatore sta cercando di mantenere il controllo di un regno sempre più instabile nel vasto universo conosciuto.

From the introduction:

Migliaia di anni dopo reiterati olocausti nucleari, la popolazione della Terra era ormai vicina all’estinzione. La struttura sociale era regredita a un sistema feudale basato sulla tecnologia sopravvissuta dai secoli precedenti. I politici e i burocrati sono stati messi al bando da quando Frederick Conestoga si era autoproclamato Imperatore. Con la riscoperta della scienza tecnologica che permetteva i viaggi spaziali, il conflitto tra l’Imperatore e i grandi Regni confinanti si inasprì al punto che questi esiliò tutte le altre casate dal pianeta, assegnando loro dei domini nello spazio profondo, molto distanti dalla Terra ma comunque nell’area di influenza dell’Imperatore. Eppure non ci fu guerra aperta e il conflitto non è ancora scoppiato, ma la paranoia tra le due casate più importanti finirà con lo sfociare in una lotta armata, che trascinerà nella lotta anche le tre casate minori. Oggi, centinaia di anni dopo la creazione di Conestoga, il nuovo Imperatore Sartini Mulingar III sta cercando di mantenere il controllo di un regno sempre più instabile nel vasto universo conosciuto.

boardgame.name: Le Terre di ShantMaere - Ambientazione
boardgame.description:
From the back of the book:

Le Terre di ShantMaere sono governate e contese da differenti civiltà umane, naniche, elfiche e orchesche, legate da un destino in cui i delicati equilibri che hanno sancito la pace possono dissolversi da un momento all'altro, complici anche le macchinazioni e gli schemi divini.

Le arti magiche prosperano tra le strade di ShantMaere, misteriosi complotti avvelenano i governi dei regni e pericolose creature abitano gli angoli più selvaggi del mondo, pronte a colpire e portare il caos nelle terre abitate.

boardgame.name: Le Terre di ShantMaere - Alarnish: La Libera Cittadina
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Situata ai margini delle fertili pianure ai confini tra Woore, Ebenheim e Stirling, si erge la libera cittadina di Alarnish, multietnico baluardo a difesa della libertà e della giustizia. La sua popolazione conta circa 15.000 abitanti, di cui la maggior parte umana, comprese le importanti comunità di nani, elfi e halfling.

boardgame.name: Eternam
boardgame.description:
This time you won't be the usual unblemished hero, but the great infernal ruler, master of demons and dragons, summoner of divinity, loved and respected by your cult and feared by the greedy governments of the world!

Eternam is a solitaire dice and cards game. Each turn you’ll roll your dice and assign them on the monster cards you play. You must choose carefully your demons and dragons, because the stronger the monsters, the more souls they will require of you, and souls are the resource you need to win the game.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: Humans vs. Humans: Outlaw
boardgame.description:
Bodies are disappearing from the cemetery.

After a catastrophic event wiped out technology across the planet, life has disintegrated back to the ways of the Wild West, where tensions are high, money is scarce, and trigger fingers are itchy. Rumor has it that the commander of the local military found one of his own men dead next to the ransacked graveyard and thinks the head of trade is behind it. The local sheriff, not sure what to believe, assigns himself to investigate the issue personally. All three put out bounties to help them set the record straight and clear up the stained name of justice that just splattered against their front doors. Word is they’re looking for you, kid.

Will you take up the call?


Humans vs. Humans: Outlaw (HvH) is a Live-Action Role-Playing game that revolves around team-based combat using Nerf or alternative brand foam blasters. Over the course of multiple days, players can participate in faction-led missions, buy class upgrades with in-game currency, and discover collectibles scattered around the world for additional clues and rewards.



Key Features


Blast your way to victory as you compete against other players in 8 action-filled missions.
Team-based system that rewards cooperation. When peril lurks in every direction, it’s dangerous to go alone.
Gameplay system that encourages unique play-styles and approaches. Do the talking directly or let your blaster say it for you.
Lovingly crafted game world with eccentric NPCs and detailed environments. Find collectibles hidden around the world for extra character details and monetary rewards.
Multiple factions looking for your support. Pledge loyalty to a cause or bounce from faction to faction in search of the best payouts.
Distinctive class system that allows for variety alongside traditional combat.
Purchasable equipment with in-game currency. Trade and barter with other players for the best deals. Who knows? When everything has a price, you might even be able to bribe the shop keep with the right bit of info.
It’s like playing a video game in real life! No longer do you have to shout in the void of digitally rendered spaces only to hear an echo: when real people are interacting with you, they have to respond!


Source: The Developer Website.

boardgame.name: Near and Far: Packturtles Meeples
boardgame.description: 12-Piece Set of Packturtles for Near and Far

boardgame.name: Linkto Terre
boardgame.description:
Linkto Terre is a co-operative trivia game in which players team up to find the key amongst the 50 cards that feature unique earth art.

Together, players link all 49 clue cards to the 50 word cards. They then discover whether the remaining, unlinked word card is the key to their victory, validating its code with the answer card to know whether they've won the game!

Linkto Terre offers five levels of difficulty in the game as well as a competitive mode for those who want it.

result.value: Some necessary text - easily memorized or small crib sheet
Moderate in-game text - needs crib sheet or paste ups
Extensive use of text - massive conversion needed to be playable

boardgame.name: It's Just a Prank Bro
boardgame.description:
From the description:

It's Just a Prank Bro is an unofficial playset for Fiasco classic where you play as narcissistic jerks who want to start a viral prank show and the people who happen to be nearby. Everything will go terribly wrong. Formatted as a handy trifold brochure!

You'll need a copy of Fiasco classic and 3-5 players to play.

boardgame.name: La Regina degli Scorpioni
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Ti ritrovi perduto nell'assolato deserto Hyrkaniano, tra un castello distrutto, temibili avversari umani solo per metà e la minaccia di perderti per sempre nelle tenebre del Mondo Sotterraneo.

boardgame.name: Altar of Shredded Memories
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Do you have questions? Questions that simply MUST be answered?

The Altar welcome all pilgrims. Enter with care, and do not forget your question. Many have come before you, and most lose themselves in the haze of history.

boardgame.name: Mini Avventure in Solitario Vol. 1
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Una raccolta di brevi avventure in solitario che include: La tomba del rospo, Zuppa d’anatra, La prova del Re, Alla deriva nell’oceano, Il Paese delle Fiabe.

boardgame.name: Mini Avventure in Solitario Vol. 2
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Una raccolta di brevi avventure in solitario che include: La torre nella palude, Pasticcio di troll, L’oasi di polvere, Una vendetta del cavolo, Il raccoglitore di anime.

boardgame.name: Rayguns, Robots & Rocketships
boardgame.description:
From the description:

An unofficial Space Age supplement for the Other world's favourite fantasy role-playing game! Within its pages you'll find:

The Other galaxy’s favourite space-age roleplaying game. Inspired by, and designed for use with, the innovative TROIKA! Ruleset.

Interorbular adventure! 5 brand-new backgrounds, including rubberworld escapees, calculating cabooses, and the OBVIOUS protagonist.

Keep the Other world clean. Inspired by the zaniest comedies across time and space, and printed on 100% recycled pulp.

I can't believe it's not magic! We used sufficiently advanced technology to formulate 5 imitation spells almost indistinguishable from the real thing!

boardgame.name: Mini Avventure in Solitario Vol. 3
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Una raccolta di brevi avventure in solitario che include: Venerdì nero, Il Sotterraneo delle Stanze Mortali di Daa’argararath!, Il Ducato delle anatre, Come l’eroe salvò la principessa, La notte che portò il Male.

boardgame.name: La Fossa di Tarsus
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Sei arrivato nelle Grandi Pianure quando sei stato assoldato come guardia da una carovana, sperando di trovare fortuna e fare qualche soldo lungo la strada...

boardgame.name: Across the Obelisk
boardgame.description:
UNRELEASED GAME – AVAILABLE




This game is still in active development and available to the public for purchase in it's unfinished state, either in Early-Alpha or Beta (or any status in between).




User Summary

A fantasy deckbuilding dungeon crawling roguelike for 1-4 players.

boardgame.name: Arium: Create
boardgame.description:
Publisher's blurb:

Arium is the name of our tabletop roleplaying game! Why? We wanted a simple name for a container of possibility.

Think of it like this: an Arium is an overarching world, universe, setting, and story/adventure seeds containing a collection of fascinating landmarks, people, and items!

Arium: Create contains our refreshing and intuitive system for creating your own Arium, and you’ll do it in one or two hours! The Arium you create will be unique to your group, and we promise everyone will be in love with it.
Create encourages folks to err on the side of awesome when collaborating to build their Arium, and the result is often surprising, but never disappointing! With a little work, you can take your resulting Arium and use it with any game system, or we’ve built in a seamless transition to our roleplaying rules found in Arium: Discover.

boardgame.name: Where Love Once Thrived
boardgame.description:
From the description:

Where Love Once Thrived is a place to reflect and maybe celebrate love for its own sake, rather than find it doesn’t live up to your expectations.

Where Love Once Thrived is a nature from the World of Wanderhome.

It is inspired by the words of Paul Heaton.

boardgame.name: Rikki-Tikki-Tavi
boardgame.description:
"The motto of all the mongoose family is, 'Run and find out'; and Rikki-tikki was a true mongoose."

Based on Rudyard Kipling's short story, Rikki-Tikki-Tavi pits Cobras and Mongooses (or "Mongeese"?) against each other. Rikki-Tikki leads the Mongoose army against Nag and Nagaina and their band of snakes, but be careful when you are scouting through the thick jungle; a harmless snake scout may turn out to be the ruthless Nagaina herself!

Each side seeks to kill the enemy leader using an army of pieces with different abilities. The type of piece is kept secret from your opponent, so you can choose whether to bluff your opponent by keeping your leader brazenly exposed, press your luck with fearless attacks, or strategically cover your pieces with a careful defense.

A modern take on the game of Chess, Rikki-Tikki-Tavi makes each game a thrilling and unique experience that can no longer be "solved", and levels the playing field between enthusiasts and newbies, while still preserving tactical gameplay.

—description from the designer

boardgame.name: La Magia Runica
boardgame.description:
From the introduction:

Un sistema di regole per applicare i poteri delle rune ad oggetti e creature, nuovi incantesimi, artefatti runici e personaggi, più un background sui simboli di potere.
